title: Discussion on Solid-UI Exports and Mashlib Dependencies
summary: The team discussed integrating the new mashlib version and addressed Jeff's decision to use mashlib instead of solid-ui due to missing exports, leading to an offer to customize solid-ui exports in a future release.

messages.body: I tested by importing the new mashlib into my local repo of the Catalog and it works fine.
I am discussion with Alain about just this. We will let you know.
On this test server only mashlib was updated, not css.
Jeff Zucker (he/him): If I remember well you are also using solid-ui directly (I may be wrong). Do you need to update version the version ?
I gave up using solid-ui directly because it does not export the things I need and mashlib does. Mashlib is complete overkill for what I need but it is the easiest option.
What do you need? Can you remind me again? Because I can export it for you in the next version.
I'll need to go back through the various apps and make a list. Will get it to you when I can.
ok. no rush.

embed_text: Discussion on Solid-UI Exports and Mashlib Dependencies: The team discussed integrating the new mashlib version and addressed Jeff's decision to use mashlib instead of solid-ui due to missing exports, leading to an offer to customize solid-ui exports in a future release.
uid: 2025-10-21 17:15:25.921::Discussion on Solid-UI Exports and Mashlib Dependencies
llm_cluster_summary: These discussions cover various aspects of the Solid project, including updates to Mashlib and Solid-UI, server maintenance, and scheduling logistics. Key themes include the deployment and testing of new Mashlib versions with architectural changes and the ongoing effort to improve Solid-UI by addressing export issues and modernizing its structure. Meeting schedules and server certificate renewals are also discussed.

title: Server Certificate Renewal Status
summary: The DevOps responsible user announced that they renewed six certificates across three servers.

messages.body: renewed 6 certs for the 3 servers of which devops I feel responsible

title: Mashlib 1.11.1 Deployment Announcement
summary: Mashlib version 1.11.1 was deployed on solidcommunity.net, and the team was asked to share this information and point to documentation regarding NLnet Grant Milestone 1a.

messages.body: Mashlib 1.11.1 was deployed on solidcommunity.net
Please mention it, for me, on other channels too
One can mention also what was done by pointing to https://solidos.solidcommunity.net/public/2025/NLnet%20Grant%20milestone%201a/Milestone1a.html
ewingson: feel free to upgrade your servers too.

title: Discussion on SolidOS Meeting Time Constraints
summary: A proposal was made to change the regular meeting time to accommodate European schedules, but concerns about conflicting availability, especially for US attendees, meant the time change remained unresolved while immediate calls were queried.

messages.body: Call today? Anyone joining?
I will be on next Wednesday

Hei everyone, I was wondering about the meetings... I cannot attend them at the time they are set now. I work in the mornings till 14:00 (CET) these days. 
Do you think we could change the meeting time to sometime before noon?

I'm normally not free in the mornings, and try to make the regular time, when I can. But it could be possible to change the time if enough people wanted to. I may be able to be free some mornings, but some I would not be able to make. The later in the morning the better, from my POV. But no need to change things on my account.
Normally we have 1-2 folks from USA, so they tend to be 6-9 hours behind europe.
Call?
I'm down for whatever. I want to make it to this SolidOS meeting this week, can you guys post a time before this upcoming Wednesday?
call now

title: Mashlib NewFace Release Testing and Architecture Changes
summary: A new mashlib release from the 'newFace' branch was introduced for testing, featuring major architectural changes including modernization, optimization, modularization of solid-logic and solid-ui, and availability as ESM, receiving positive early feedback.

messages.body: Hei everyone, a new mashlib (from branch newFace) is ready to be tested. Please make a user and try some stuff out here: https://pivot-test.solidproject.org:3000/

This release is the 2nd milestone of the grant work, focused on modernization and optimization of the codebase. It will end in major releases for all repos. If you want to take a look at the exact code, look at the newFace branches on all repos. Some things to consider:

- solid-logic, solid-ui are bundeled without rdflib. Solid-ui si bundleled without solid-logic even. -> this means - you need to import rdflib and solid-logic if you want to make use of solid-ui. (mashlib, of course contains it all).
Why? architecturally this is cleaner and it did reduce the mashlib bundlesize.
- solid-logic and solid-ui are now available also as ESM not just CommonJS.
The solid-logic dependency is: https://www.npmjs.com/package/solid-logic/v/3.1.1-db26ace
Solid-ui: https://www.npmjs.com/package/solid-ui/v/2.6.1-ad0c401

I will prepare a blogpost with all changes done.
Please feedback and comment and see if you find errors.
Great work, I am a fan of ESM
worked for me, great job timea-solid

embed_text: Mashlib NewFace Release Testing and Architecture Changes: A new mashlib release from the 'newFace' branch was introduced for testing, featuring major architectural changes including modernization, optimization, modularization of solid-logic and solid-ui, and availability as ESM, receiving positive early feedback.
